rootSummary: This directory serves as the root for a TypeScript-based calculator application built using the Next.js framework. It contains the essential configuration files, UI components, and core logic needed to develop, build, and deploy the web application.

.nexhacks/capsules.json.upperLevelSummary: Provides project statistics and metadata detailing file counts, directory structure, and external dependencies. Operates as an independent data store for project analysis without any internal dependencies or dependents.

README.md.name: README.md

metadata.firstNLines:
This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

README.md.upperLevelSummary: This file provides project documentation and setup instructions for a Next.js application initialized via create-next-app. It serves as a standalone developer guide with no functional integration or dependencies within the codebase.

app/globals.css.name: globals.css
app/globals.css.upperLevelSummary: This file defines global CSS variables and base reset styles to establish the application's core visual theme and layout. It is imported by the root layout file to provide consistent styling across the entire application.

app/layout.tsx.name: layout.tsx
app/layout.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This root layout defines the global metadata and base structure for the entire Next.js application. It imports global CSS styles and acts as the top-level wrapper for all child pages and components.

app/page.module.css.name: page.module.css
app/page.module.css.upperLevelSummary: This CSS module defines layout and typography styles for the application's primary landing page elements. It serves as a standalone styling asset with no current internal dependencies or external consumers.

app/page.tsx.name: page.tsx
app/page.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines the Home page component that renders the main calculator interface within a centered layout. Serves as the primary application entry point and integrates the Calculator component alongside the Visualizer module.

components/Button.module.css.name: Button.module.css
components/Button.module.css.upperLevelSummary: This CSS module defines the layout, typography, and interactive styling for a button element. It is imported and applied exclusively within the Button.tsx component.

components/Button.tsx.name: Button.tsx
components/Button.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines a calculator button component that supports multiple visual variants and custom click interactions. It imports styles from a local CSS module and is utilized by the ButtonGrid component.

components/ButtonGrid.module.css.name: ButtonGrid.module.css
components/ButtonGrid.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines a responsive four-column grid layout with variable spacing for button organization. Provides modular styling used exclusively by the ButtonGrid component.

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.name: ButtonGrid.tsx

metadata.firstNLines:
import Button from "./Button";
import styles from "./ButtonGrid.module.css";

interface ButtonGridProps {
    onButtonClick: (value: string) => void;
}

/**
 * Calculator button grid component
 * Arranges buttons in a 4x5 grid layout
 */
export default function ButtonGrid({ onButtonClick }: ButtonGridProps) {
    const buttons = [
        { value: "C", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "±", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "%", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "÷", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "7", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "8", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "9", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "×", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "4", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "5", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "6", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "-", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "1", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "2", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "3", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "+", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "0", variant: "number" as const, wide: true },

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component renders a 4x5 grid of interactive calculator buttons to handle user input events. It is integrated into the Calculator component and depends on the Button component and local CSS modules.

components/Calculator.module.css.name: Calculator.module.css
components/Calculator.module.css.upperLevelSummary: This module defines the visual styles, layout, and responsive design for the calculator's primary container and interface elements. It is imported and utilized by the Calculator component to apply scoped CSS classes.

components/Calculator.tsx.name: Calculator.tsx
components/Calculator.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Manages state and orchestrates calculation logic for the main user interface. Coordinates the display and button grid components while utilizing internal utility functions and modular styling.

components/Display.module.css.name: Display.module.css
components/Display.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Provides visual styles and layout configurations for a display container and its history section. The module is consumed exclusively by the Display component and has no external dependencies.

components/Display.tsx.name: Display.tsx
components/Display.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component renders the calculator's visual interface to display the current numeric value and calculation history. It is used by the Calculator component and depends on a local CSS module for styling.

eslint.config.mjs.name: eslint.config.mjs
eslint.config.mjs.upperLevelSummary: This file defines the project's ESLint configuration by combining Next.js web vitals and TypeScript rules with specific global ignore patterns. It exports the `eslintConfig` object for use by the linting engine and functions independently of other local codebase files.

lib/calculator.ts.name: calculator.ts

metadata.fileDocstring:
*
 * Calculator logic module
 * Contains pure mathematical functions for calculator operations

functionSignatures.name: add
functionSignatures.signature: export function add(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: subtract

functionSignatures.name: multiply
functionSignatures.signature: export function multiply(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: divide
functionSignatures.signature: export function divide(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: calculate
functionSignatures.signature: export function calculate(a: number, operation: Operation, b: number): number

lib/calculator.ts.upperLevelSummary: This module provides pure mathematical functions, input parsing, and display formatting for calculator operations. It serves as a standalone utility used by the Calculator component and has no local dependencies.

next-env.d.ts.name: next-env.d.ts
next-env.d.ts.upperLevelSummary: This file provides global TypeScript type definitions for Next.js core features and image handling. It integrates the development environment with the framework by importing generated route types from the local build directory.

next.config.ts.name: next.config.ts
next.config.ts.upperLevelSummary: Defines the build and runtime configuration options for the Next.js application. Exports the nextConfig object as a standalone module with no local dependencies or internal dependents.

package-lock.json.name: package-lock.json
package-lock.json.upperLevelSummary: This file locks the exact versions of project dependencies to ensure consistent and reproducible builds across environments. It tracks the dependency tree for the calculator application, managing core requirements like Next.js and React.

package.json.name: package.json
package.json.upperLevelSummary: This file defines the metadata and execution scripts for a Next.js-based calculator application. It manages core external dependencies like React and Next.js to facilitate project development and deployment.

public/capsules.json.upperLevelSummary: This JSON file stores metadata and structural statistics about the project, including file counts and external dependencies. It acts as a standalone public asset with no internal dependencies or consumers in the codebase.

tsconfig.json.name: tsconfig.json
tsconfig.json.upperLevelSummary: Configures TypeScript compiler settings for strict type-checking and ES2017 target compatibility. Acts as the central build configuration for the project with no local dependencies or exports.
